attributes.action: abandon the contact point database of our children's personal information including the home address of every child under the age of 18
attributes.action_prefix: We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to
attributes.background:
We the undersigned petition the Prime Minister to abandon the
     Contact Point database of our children's personal information
     including home address of every child under the age of 18.

     The data base is being created under the Children Act 2004. 

     Schools will be obliged to provide the following  information
     on every child under the age of 18 to the local council: name,
     DOB, home address, gender, a unique ID number and contact
     details for their parents/carers and "service providers" 

     300,000 "Professionals" will have access to the data

     The Independent Schools Council is opposed to the introduction
     of Contact Point It says

     "It is an unjustified interference in the majority of children
     and their carers"

     "It will put some children at risk through data theft or loss"

     "It will be a register of poor quality data which may create a
     misleading or unhelpful impression of the child"

     Annette Brooke, the Liberal Democrat spokeswoman for children,
     was quoted as saying "This is an absolute bombshell and
     confirms all of our worst fears."

     And the cost to us taxpayers - estimated at £224 million.

     I ask the government to abandon the roll out of this database
